intro: Chenopodium lineare, commonly known as slender goosefoot, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, and its seeds are encased in a hard, triangular capsule. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Chenopodium lineare is characterized by its succulent stems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
